channel.title: MoparJam - The rest
channel.description:
Ok, now we've established that this will take place during a weekend. Now we need to get a group of critics for a Jury. Anyone who's interested in this, PM me.
Next up, what weekend? We'll have to decide on a date.

item.title: MoparJam - The rest
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:32, topic:362245”][quote author=RLN link=topic=458530.msg3360399#msg3360399 date=1286312408]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=458530.msg3360393#msg3360393 date=1286312234]

[quote author=RLN link=topic=458530.msg3360381#msg3360381 date=1286311512]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=458530.msg3360357#msg3360357 date=1286309974]
I’ve already stated in the previous thread that JavaSE will be the platform of choice, which means no additional libraries or technologies. I very much agree with Thug-life in that it wouldn’t be fair.

Hell, this thread has gone way too off-topic, get back on track!
[/quote]Right, right people using home-brew 3d rendering engines will make for optimal fairness
[/quote]Good luck writing a decent 3d game with your own engine in 48 hours…
[/quote]Not saying I would even bother, its just the principle
[/quote]The thought isn’t really to write a well-designed and polished stock game, The whole point is to experiment and try new things, something which can be accomplished using 2d in nearly all cases.

See: The whole indie-gaming scene[/quote]

That’s why android development would be neat, to experiment and try new things. Very few to none of us have android development experience (I do, but only menus and trivial stuff, no 2d or game knowledge at all), so that’s why it would be neat. You also develop with JavaSE by the way.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparJam - The rest
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

You have a point there in regards to the uniformity everyone developing on Android, that would certainly help define some requirements. As for the form factor, those who can test it on the phone can tune controls based on how comfortable it is the hold the phone and play the game, others can’t.

I won’t be joining in, I just don’t see complete fairness in allowing Android development. Maybe I put too much weight on the difference in ability to tune interface and controls when having the ability to test it on hardware though.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparJam - The rest
item.dc:creator: @RLN RLN
item.description:
@RLN wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:25, topic:362245”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=458530.msg3358934#msg3358934 date=1286155308]

Doing Android games wouldn’t be fair on those who don’t have Android phones. Those with, can finely tune their control with the touch screen because they can actually test it.

What about keyboard controlled games only?
[/quote]

Suppose, but still, without everyone having an Android phone, you’re just developing on Android for the sake of it. You’re not taking advantage of the platform, nor the form factor of the device and how you’d typically design a game for the system.[/quote]
Actually this whole concept depends heavily on doing things “for the sake of it”. As for “not taking advantage of the platform” (and also in regards to your comment about form factor)… it really has no advantages over any other decent platform other than portability and trendiness. In my opinion using the android platform would just make the contest more challenging and at the same time make the judging easier because all works will be judged on the same paradigm.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparJam - The rest
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:19, topic:362245”][quote author=Thug-life link=topic=458530.msg3358671#msg3358671 date=1286141537]
Doing Android games wouldn’t be fair on those who don’t have Android phones. Those with, can finely tune their control with the touch screen because they can actually test it.
[/quote]

What about keyboard controlled games only?[/quote]

Suppose, but still, without everyone having an Android phone, you’re just developing on Android for the sake of it. You’re not taking advantage of the platform, nor the form factor of the device and how you’d typically design a game for the system.

Read full topic

item.title: MoparJam - The rest
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:23, topic:362245”][quote author=Bowser jr link=topic=458530.msg3359296#msg3359296 date=1286212567]

if you allow android why don’t we all just got make some xbox 360 games or maybe ps3???

If you program it in Java, and provide emulator for those who don’t have Xbox 360 and Ps3 then I would agree.
[/quote]

Exactly, the android dev environment including an emulator is free and runs everywhere, if we wrote for Wii, Xbox, or PS3 we wouldn’t have that.[/quote]
Is there a seperate emulator for it?

I still don’t like the idea of judging games which I’d have to play on an emulator, but I guess I can’t change the rules. Unfortunately.

Read full topic

[/quote]

then we brand the winning game with the mitb logo, and release it into the market

item.title: MoparJam - The rest
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:9, topic:362245”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=458530.msg3355924#msg3355924 date=1285866792]

I guess I could judge if the judging period is long enough.
And uh, I think it’d be better to limit the games to the PC, so everyone can check them out, it’s rather hard to judge something on a platform you haven’t got!

The Android emulator runs on a PC, and it’s cross-platform and free. So all judges could run the games in the android emulator.
[/quote]

I still think pitting two different platforms and even programming languages is a bit unfair, so if we do decide to allow multiple programming languages and platforms we should have different categories/awards for each one. eg, java, c#, c++, c, android, other. Then we could have an overall one which considers all of them regardless of platform/language.

I wouldn’t mind judging if i’m allow :s[/quote]

Android apps are written in Java, so it’s the same language.

Read full topic
